intro: Festuca latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf fescue, is a cool-season grass native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its wide, flat blades and dense growth habit, making it suitable for lawns and erosion control. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm and has a clump-forming structure. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Festuca latifolia is drought-tolerant and requires minimal maintenance once established.
